conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle through the electric and magnetic fields.
The particle is launched horizontally with velocity v_0 and enters the magnetic field at point P.
The angle between the particle's velocity direction when entering the magnetic field and PQ is 60 degrees.
The electric field is uniform and directed vertically downward with strength E.
The force on the particle due to the electric field is F_E = qE, acting downward.
The particle experiences constant acceleration a = qE/m downward.
The horizontal velocity v_0 remains unchanged as there is no horizontal force.
When the particle enters the magnetic field at point P, it has a vertical velocity component v_y due to the acceleration in the electric field.
Using kinematic equations, v_y = a t = (qE/m) t.
Using the angle 60 degrees, tan(60) = v_y/v_0, so v_y = sqrt(3) v_0.
The time t to reach point P is t = (sqrt(3) v_0 m)/(qE).
The horizontal distance d to point P is d = v_0 t = (sqrt(3) v_0^2 m)/(qE).
The distance from the particle's launch position to point P is (sqrt(3) v_0^2 m)/(qE).
